benchmark_details.name: AnnotatedTables
benchmark_details.overview: AnnotatedTables is a large scale tabular dataset with large language model annotations. It addresses the tabular dataset annotation problem by using LLMs to automate annotation for SQL and other types of tag, containing 32,119 databases and 405,616 valid SQL programs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To leverage large language models (LLMs) for annotating tabular datasets automatically, reducing the dependency on human labor for dataset annotation.

data.source: Collection of public Kaggle datasets with tabular data.
data.annotation: Automatically generated by large language models (LLMs) through zero-shot learning.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the validity of SQL programs executed on their respective databases.
methodology.interpretation: Higher execution accuracy indicates more reliable LLM-generated SQL queries.
methodology.baseline_results: AnnotatedTables reports execution rates above 80% for SQL queries, indicating strong annotation quality.
methodology.validation: Tests conducted included running SQL queries on the annotated tabular data to verify their correctness.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The datasets are collected from Kaggle, and their licenses can be found individually on Kaggle's website.
